name: Astranis
headline: Advanced satellites for high orbits.
description: Astranis builds the world's most advanced satellites for high orbits. Their first product, MicroGEO, offers dedicated satellite broadband. But small, radiation-tolerant satellites can do far more than comms. With contracts in place with Space Force, NASA, and other government partners, Astranis is working across all higher orbits to support government science, PNT, and communications missions.

raw_markdown="[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/66f9bdfc6b6fd608f72931d5_Astranis%20Logo%20Main.svg)](http://www.astranis.com/</>)

[CAREERS](http://www.astranis.com/</careers>)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/66e202cffb3ca3599af3c121_image%2028%20\(1\).png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/671acbdaacb99bf9e57ddef7_earthlight.webp)
# The world's most advanced high-orbit satellites
[LEARN MORE](http://www.astranis.com/<#ANIMATION>)
### Five on orbit today, many more launching soon.
Before Astranis, satellites came in one of two types: small and inexpensive for low earth orbit, or large and expensive for high orbits. At Astranis we built a new class of satellite— small, powerful satellites for high orbits with the latest in digital processing technology. Astranis has more than 10 satellites on contract for customers around the world, representing more than $1 billion of satellite services sold.
TRUSTED BY
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/66f11272b3f2015fa62d47ff_SpaceForce%20SVG.svg)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/66f112acfd281cd72b4f4478_Anuvu%20Logo.svg)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/66f33579a4aefeb1701e8ad7_Capa_1.svg)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/66e3d8a7dbbda3a5a21db47e_Orbits%20Logo.png)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/66fc6fcc857553c27f5a1860_logo%20blanco-ai%20\(2\).svg)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/66f113134e47eccdd59d7985_WhitethaicomLogo-revisedHi%20\(1\).png)
### High orbits matter.
Geostationary orbit (GEO) is the most valuable real estate in the solar system, with over $15 billion of satellites launched to GEO annually, and Medium Earth Orbit (MEO) is home to mission-critical space systems like GPS. Why?
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/66f1d65f2130575c8ba28644_Government%20Earth%20Left%20\(1\).png)
### High orbits mean dedicated assets.
The higher you go, the fewer satellites you need to provide constant service — all the way to GEO, where a single satellite can carry out a 24/7 mission on its own. Fewer satellites mean lower costs, simpler and cheaper user terminals, and savings that are passed on to end customers.
[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/66f0cf35a7fbec154a0de631_WhitethaicomLogo-revised.png)Thaicom selects Astranis to build and operate THAICOM-9.](http://www.astranis.com/<http:/www.astranis.com/blog/astranis-partners-with-thaicom-to-provide-thaicom-9-satellite-over-asia-18f83>)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/66f1d65f2130575c8ba28644_Government%20Earth%20Left%20\(1\).png)
### High orbits offer critical services.
The device in your pocket (or hand) is currently listening to a constellation of high-orbit satellites — GPS. We’re using our high-orbit satellites to enhance GPS resiliency alongside Space Force, ensuring continued delivery of position, navigation, and timing transmissions to warfighters and the public at large.
[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/66f0cf9900becd0daba669c7_Space%20Force%20SVG%20Logo.svg)Astranis selected to design next-gen Resilient GPS satellites.](http://www.astranis.com/<http:/www.astranis.com/blog/astranis-rgps-announcement-a8oc>)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/66f1d65f2130575c8ba28644_Government%20Earth%20Left%20\(1\).png)
### High orbits are the ultimate high ground.
Space is a contested domain, and Low-Earth Orbit is at risk of catastrophic loss. High orbits offer greater security: by staying above the fray, they are less vulnerable to ground-based threats and offer more decision time to react to contingencies, whether incidental or intentional.
[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/66f0cf9900becd0daba669c7_Space%20Force%20SVG%20Logo.svg)Astranis announces new contract for US government mission.](http://www.astranis.com/<https:/www.astranis.com/blog/arcturus-usg-demo-ecaa0>)
### Building advanced satellites for high orbits is hard.
Astranis has surmounted some incredible engineering challenges to bring this product to market. The radiation environment beyond Low Earth Orbit would fry any normal computer hardware in days or hours. This requires high-orbit satellites to be radiation-hardened, which traditionally drives cost up and timelines out. Launching to higher orbits is also considerably harder. Medium-class rockets can’t take you all the way there, so high-orbit satellites usually need expensive and complex on-board propulsion systems.
In-House Testing
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/672479ec7a30210d02842ccf_MANUFACTURING%20\(1\).png)
In-House Manufacturing
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/67248ad97ccf3de7aaf5916c_satfloor%20\(1\).jpg)
In-House Machining
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/66f0cb130b8189b7dca8a017_MANUFACTURING%20HOMEPAGE.jpg)
### Small, radiation-hardened spacecraft were thought impossible.Until we built them.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/66f0f7ed6b12aad1d3b66852_Satellite%20Render%201.png)
### Proudly Made in America
We design, manufacture, test, and operate our satellites at our global headquarters at Historic Pier 70 in California. Our facility previously built warships during the World Wars. Now it builds spaceships.
![The Astranis Mechanical Integration Team, sitting around 4 completed satellites.](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/67248922e0286d1ee2bbde5b_Interior%20-%20Main%20Atrium%20\(1\)%20\(1\).jpg)

[Introducing: Astranis Omega](http://www.astranis.com/</blog/introducing-astranis-omega-1e93d>)
[Astranis partners with Thaicom to provide Thaicom-9 satellite over Asia](http://www.astranis.com/</blog/astranis-partners-with-thaicom-to-provide-thaicom-9-satellite-over-asia-18f83>)
[Astranis announces new contract for US government mission, starting with on-orbit demonstration using Arcturus satellite](http://www.astranis.com/</blog/arcturus-usg-demo-ecaa0>)
[More in Newsroom](http://www.astranis.com/</newsroom>)[More in Newsroom](http://www.astranis.com/</newsroom>)
[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66d8f757eb129d1a1706d930/66db41d3fe71137c525f18b2_Logo%20Mark.svg)](http://www.astranis.com/</>)
Astranis builds the world's most advanced satellites for high orbits. Our first product, MicroGEO, offers dedicated satellite broadband. But small, radiation-tolerant satellites can do far more than comms. With contracts in place with Space Force, NASA, and other government partners, Astranis is working across all higher orbits to support government science, PNT, and communications missions.
Copyright © 2024 Astranis

generated_description:
**Astranis: Building the Future of High-Orbit Satellites**

In the realm of space technology, Astranis is making waves by redefining what’s possible with satellites. Founded in 2016 and part of Y Combinator's W16 program, this San Francisco-based company has a mission: to develop advanced satellites for high orbits. Their debut product, MicroGEO, is a game-changer, providing dedicated satellite broadband that goes beyond simple communication.

**What Sets Astranis Apart?**

Astranis stands out by creating small, radiation-tolerant satellites designed for high orbits, representing a crucial middle ground between traditional large satellites (which are costly and complex) and smaller, ephemeral options intended mainly for low Earth orbit. This innovative approach allows them to tap into more than $1 billion in satellite services already contracted with a range of clients, including the Space Force and NASA. 

Their satellites aren’t just about communications; they support pivotal government missions in science, positioning, navigation, and timing (PNT). In an age where GPS is critical for both personal and military uses, Astranis is ensuring that these vital services remain resilient even in challenging circumstances.

**The Astranis Team and Operations**

With a workforce of around 400 passionate employees, Astranis has positioned itself as a leader in the space industry. Located at Historic Pier 70 in California, their facility is steeped in history, previously manufacturing warships, now transformed into a hub for building advanced spacecraft.

**Facing Challenges Head-On**

Building satellites for high orbits isn't without its hurdles. The radiation environment at these altitudes can damage conventional hardware in mere hours. However, Astranis has managed to overcome these engineering challenges, resulting in the creation of spacecraft that many deemed impossible until now.

The company prioritizes in-house testing, manufacturing, and machining to maintain tight controls over quality and innovation. This hands-on approach ensures that every satellite built meets the rigorous demands of space.

**Looking to the Future**

Astranis isn't just sitting on its initial success. With a slew of upcoming launches and partnerships, they are poised to expand their reach. Their vision is ambitious and aligns with a growing need for more efficient, reliable satellite services in a space where high orbits are increasingly viewed as the "ultimate high ground."

In summary, Astranis exemplifies what it means to pioneer in the aerospace sector. By focusing on high-orbit satellites, they are not only meeting critical communication and navigation needs but are also setting the stage for future advancements in space technology. The sky isn’t the limit; it’s just the beginning for Astranis.

If you want to learn more or join their journey, check them out at [Astranis](http://www.astranis.com).
